Module jtrim.task.graph
Package org.jtrim2.taskgraph

Class TaskFactories

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.taskgraph.TaskFactories
public final class TaskFactories extends Object
Defines utility methods to implement task node factories.

  • Method Details

    • delegateToCustomKey

      public static <R, I> TaskFactory<R,I> delegateToCustomKey(Function<? super I,?> customKeySelector)
      Creates a task factory which delegates its call to another already declared task factory with a selected custom key. That is, when the returned factory is invoked with a particular task node key, the factory will create a node depending and returning the result of a node with the same node key, except that the custom key of the task factory key will be replaced with the newly selected custom key.

      This method was designed to help with the case, when there are multiple ways to calculate a particular value but one has to be selected based on the factory argument.

      The returned factory will always set its executor to a cheap synchronous task executor because the node it creates will simply return its input (i.e., the output of the selected node).

      Type Parameters:
      R - the return type of the task factory
      I - the factory argument type of the task factory
      Parameters:
      customKeySelector - the function selecting the new custom key of the task factory argument to which the returned factory will delegate its call to. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a task factory which delegates its call to another already declared task factory with a selected custom key. This method never returns null.

    • delegateToFactoryArg

      public static <R, I, I2> TaskFactory<R,I> delegateToFactoryArg(Class<I2> newArgType, Function<? super I,? extends I2> argTransformer)
      Creates a task factory delegating its call to another already declared task factory with a different factory argument type. The conversion between the factory argument must be provided.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the return type of the computation created by the factories
      I - the factory argument type of the returned task factory
      I2 - the factory argument type of the dependency
      Parameters:
      newArgType - the factory argument type of the dependency. This argument cannot be null.
      argTransformer - the function transforming the factory argument to the factory argument of the dependency. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      a task factory delegating its call to another already declared task factory with a different factory argument type. This method never returns null.

    • delegateTo

      public static <R, I, I2> TaskFactory<R,I> delegateTo(Function<TaskNodeKey<R,I>,TaskNodeKey<R,I2>> dependencyFactory)
      Creates a task factory delegating its call to another already declared task factory. That is, when this factory is invoked with a particular task node key, the factory will create node which depends on another based on the given dependency selector function.

      The returned factory will always set its executor to a cheap synchronous task executor because the node it creates will simply return its input (i.e., the output of the selected node).

      Type Parameters:
      R - the return type of the computation created by the factories
      I - the factory argument type of the returned factory
      I2 - the factory argument type of the dependency
      Parameters:
      dependencyFactory - the function selecting the dependency node whose result is to be forwarded by the returned factory. The argument of the function is the node key identifying the node to be created by the returned factory (which cannot be null. This argument cannot be null and the function may not return a null value.
      Returns:
      the task factory delegating its call to another already declared task factory. This method never returns null.

    • transformResult

      public static <R, I, R2> TaskFactory<R,I> transformResult(Class<R2> dependencyResultType, Function<? super R2,? extends R> resultTransformer)
      Creates a task factory creating nodes depending on a node with the same key except with the result type changed. The result of the dependency is converted using the given transformation.
      Type Parameters:
      R - the return type of the computation created by the return factory
      I - the factory argument type of the factories
      R2 - the return type of the computation created by the dependency
      Parameters:
      dependencyResultType - the type of the return type of the dependency. This argument cannot be null.
      resultTransformer - the transformation converting the result of the dependency. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the task factory creating nodes depending on a node with the same key except with the result type changed. This method never returns null.
